@prashant22: dude i've a doubt in encoding quality
which looks better in quality of these two??
Blu ray : 1080p source ripped into 3.33 gb with Video Codec name: AVC MPEG-4
Avg. Bitrate: 2695 Kbps
Encoding: 2 Pass
Resolution: 1280 x 528

or

a video ripped from a 720p source with 6.6 gb size and having 1280x536 @ 4821 Kbps
and audio at DTS 1509 Kbps
which of the above two looks good in quality???

Is this a joke? The title says 720p, but the video resolution is 1280x536, so this movie IS NOT 720p, 720p is 1280x720

@Blackbird_CaD
actually ur knowledge abt 720p is a joke...get some knowledge first dont post nonsence comments...

i can explain this aspect ratio thing... as i wondered that in the start too.. 
actually 720p = 1280 x 720 = 16:9 aspect ratio.
but now movies r not released in this ratio... inception's original ratio is 2.35:1 ... which should be 1280 x 544.. 
so this shld be called 536p but since it is ripped from a 720p bluray it is rightly called 720p...

p.s : i may be wrong  :D

Ya and it may be helpful 2 save some space like 20-50MB
: )

ya if ur encoding a 1280x544 and size is 700mb so to get same quality the size may increse by 30% for 1280x720...
